intro: Linociera lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved linociera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and is often found in lowland areas. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Linociera lancifolia is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
